intro: Canthium culionense, commonly known as the Culion bignay, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody structure and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or yellow in color. It is often found in lowland forests and is adapted to humid, tropical climates. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
